bio:treatment.description: Plants loosely cespitose, without rhizomes. Innovations extravaginal, with or without basal cataphylls. Blades flat or convolute; ribs shallow, indistinct; sclerenchyma girders present at the major veins. Calluses wider than long; lemmas chartaceous, lanceolate to attenuate, entire, unawned; ovary apices densely pubescent.
bio:treatment.discussion: Festuca subg. Montanae contains approximately 20-25 species. It has been divided into seven sections that are widely distributed on all continents except Africa and Antarctica. One monospecific section occurs in North America.
